andComment: This anvil tried to kill me but I was quicker than it.
The writing on the side says 'one hundred tons' so...
It probably weights enough for killing a person.
And enough for not being picked by me.
So, sorry. I'm not going to pick this weight up.

lines: Thank you for the metallic gift but...
A tree branch with a curious flat shape.
This tree is a... a... 'Tabula Arbor'.
It's called like this for his windsurf-like branches.
'Tabula Arbor' is a great name. I'll use it in my lecture tomorrow.

andComment: I'm ready to go.
There.
Where no man has gone before.
At least, 13 million years ago.
A rubber chicken with a pulley in the middle.
Some early communities of the Island of Monkeys...
...used it along cables as mean of transport or...
...as ingredient for mystical spells.
Anyway, it has no use nowadays, so I'll leave that where it is.

lines: Thank you for the geeky gift but...

andComment: A deep deep deep...
...deep deep deep...
...deep and deadly cliff.
Collecting stones is a pleasant hobby.
But sadly it's not for me.

lines: A stone my new friend Pietrolastricus sent to me.
It doesn't happen so often that a Miocene guy send you a gift.
Thank you for the monotonous gift but...
I got it. I can fix the time machine.
I have just to look that pieces intensively from here...
...and try to rewind time with my mind...
I surely can repair the machine with these plastic handcuffs.
I can do it. I can do it.
Now I have just to invent the time machine again.
I'll go back home in no time.
My only way out from this time is...
On the other side of a deep cliff.
Is there any prize for two numbers?

andComment: My time machine is stuck on that tree.
I need it for going back to my time.
I'll use it once my photos of the Miocene epoch are ready but...
Knowing that my ticket back is OK and I'll not die here...
Can make my day brighter.
My plan is going along nicely.
He. He. He.
Because...
Do you know my plan, right?
The X on the floor makes this spot very interesting.
If I had a showel, I'll surely dig for a treasure but...
Pirates didn't exist 13 million years ago, so I think that...
...this X is here by chance.
Mumble. Mumble.
There is this deep and deadly cliff in the middle and...
Since I don't want to die, I prefer to stay here, thanks.

lines: A house with a window in this age?

choices: Why are you trying to kill me?
How did you invent anvil in Miocene?
How's the view from up there?

lines: Probably you expect me to understand these screams.
It could be a nice gag for this game but...
But I guess he has its good reasons.
At least, by hearing the length and the pitch of the screams.
He says that it wasn't invented by him. Nor by humanity.
The mindbenders alien race brought them on earth.
He is throwing them from that tree as part of its rebellion.
Do you expect me to understand that screams?
'A brontosaurus is drinking water from there.'
'Looking at the sun, today is the 3rd of September.'
Probably I have to guess its name.
...in a game without any sound. Don't you think?
Time to check if the name paleoanthropologist gave your race is right.
A rubber chicken with a pulley in the middle?
I wonder how many of these he has on that tree.
He reserved me just merciless silence.
This time we've got a plain boring stone.
I wonder if I guessed the right name.
Whatever. Probably he is still angry.
But I never gonna give you up.
HEY YOU! HUMANOID CREATURE FROM THE PAST!
I'm going to give you a BRAND NEW name!
And you're going to like that...

andComment: Jan-ken-pon. Paper versus Rock. I won!

lines: Refusing a gift is bad manners, Mr. Sassertal.
Better bringing Pietrolastricus' gift with me.
Better making some room before placing it.
Will this tool work well enough for cutting wood...
...and build the first wooden home in human history?
So, since there are weak probabilities of making another tool...
...I can confirm that 13 million years ago there weren't cottages.
But I've got this 'Tabula Arbor' branch now.
It oddly looks like a wooden plank.
'A missing bridge is less useful than an actual one.'
Madrid adventurers are obsessed by plastic handcuffs...
Yeah. Probably I'm able to join these two planks now...
...but since I've just disintegrated a time machine...
...better moving to the other side before being creative again.
Safety first. A larger bridge is a good idea but...
How can I tie together these two planks?
Heigh-ho, heigh-ho, It's off to work we go.
I keep on singing all day long, Heigh-ho.
Better not trying my luck another time.
Primitive men used to hit rocks in order to make tools.
In 2014 we experimented with monkeys that...
...it could be happened by chance. So...
If I use this rock and hit the other one...
Look at this lithic tool I've made!
Well... It looks sharp enough for cutting stuff and...
It comes with an handle too.
I admit that I've PROBABLY done something wrong.
The machine totally DISINTEGRATED after touching the ground!
I mean. It's all Colin fault if I'll die here!
But no one will tell him the truth if I'll die.
Time to pay a visit to our Pietrolastricus friend...
...to thank him for his rocky present and...
...to ask about the anvils he has. There's something fishy here.
Oh. Dang. The machine is stuck on that tree!
Me and the machine have been transported in different places.
Luckly I fell on a bush and I'm okay.
But I have to bring my equine companion down.
I should have a long chat with Colin once my photos are ready.
The position of the sun in the sky...
Today is the 13 million years ago.
Let's work now... I have to...
Someone on that tree tried to kill me with this anvil!
Wait. An anvil 13 million years ago?

object.label: Chicken
object.interaction: Look at the chicken with a pulley

object.label: Someone
object.interaction: Look at someone on the tree
